To investigate whether <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> independence was due to endogenous <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression , <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription was assessed by an Rnase protection assay ( RPA ) .

text: <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription was detectable with control RNA and faintly in the mouse lymphoma cell line K46mu ( Figure 4A ) .

However , <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription was not detectable in <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + MACS-purified B cells from wild-type lymphocytes ( unpublished data ) , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphocytes , or lymphoma cells , although the <extra_id_0> GAPDH <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> L32 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> controls were effectively protected ( Figure 4A ) .

Activated <extra_id_0> Stat6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> pStat6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , a target of the <extra_id_0> IL4 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> pathway , was detected in the wild-type and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphocytes ( Figure 4B ) .

text: In contrast , pStat6 was barely detected in either the wild-type or <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells .

However , the pathway was not disabled , as treatment of the lymphoma cells with <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced <extra_id_0> Stat6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation ( Figure 4C ) .

text: Although wild-type lymphocytes can not be maintained in culture with <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> supplementation alone ( Figure 3A ) , slight enhancement in MTS activity could be detected if the cells were analyzed at an earlier time point , at 1 d ( Figure 4D ) versus 3 d ( Figure 3A ) post-harvest .

The enhancement of MTS activity induced by <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in wild-type lymphocytes could be neutralized by the addition of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody ( Figure 4D ) .

However , neutralizing antibodies to <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> did not affect the MTS activity of <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells ( Figure 4E ) .

In summary , the wild-type and <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphoma cells grew independently of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment and did not require <extra_id_0> Stat6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling .
